title: Smoky Paprika Shrimp Skewers
description: Plump shrimp marinated in smoked paprika, garlic and citrus, threaded onto skewers and quickly grilled or broiled for a charred, smoky finish. Bright lemon and fresh herbs balance the heat for a vibrant, easy-to-make seafood entree or party appetizer.

ingredients.display_name: raw large shrimp, peeled and deveined (16-20 count) tails on or off as preferred
ingredients.notes: about 16-20 large shrimp (approx 6-8 oz per pound); thaw and pat dry

ingredients.display_name: honey or maple syrup (for slight glaze)
wooden or metal skewers (if wooden, soaked 30 minutes)
ingredients.notes: use 2-3 shrimp per skewer depending on size

steps.text: If using wooden skewers, soak them in water for at least 30 minutes to prevent burning. Meanwhile pat shrimp dry and place in a medium bowl.

Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, smoked paprika, sweet paprika, ground cumin, minced garlic, crushed red pepper, honey (if using), kosher salt and black pepper in a small bowl to form the marinade.

Pour about three-quarters of the marinade over the shrimp and toss to coat evenly; reserve the remaining marinade for brushing after cooking. Cover and refrigerate to marinate for 10 minutes (do not exceed 30 minutes for best texture).
Thread shrimp onto skewers, piercing once near the head end and once near the tail so each shrimp lies flat; leave a little space between shrimp for even heat circulation.
Preheat a grill to medium-high (about 400–450°F) or set the oven broiler on high with a rack 6 inches from the heat. Oil the grates or a baking sheet lightly to prevent sticking.
Grill or broil the skewers 2–3 minutes per side until opaque and just cooked through with light char marks; total cook time should be 4–6 minutes depending on shrimp size. Turn once midway.
During the last minute of cooking, brush the reserved marinade lightly over the shrimp to glaze, then remove skewers from heat and let rest for 1 minute.
Transfer skewers to a platter, sprinkle with chopped parsley, serve with lemon wedges and additional crushed red pepper if desired.
